pkgmetadata.longdescription: Django jQuery=============Requirements------------`Django <https://www.djangoproject.com/>`_ 1.3 or laterInstallation------------:: $ pip install django-jquerySetup-----Just add ``'django.contrib.staticfiles'`` and ``'jquery'`` to INSTALLED_APPS inyour settings.py:: INSTALLED_APPS = ( # ... 'django.contrib.staticfiles', 'jquery', # ... )Refer to Django `static files <https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/howto/static-files/>`_documentation to configure and deploy static files.Usage-----You can refer to jquery in your template with:: {{ STATIC_URL }}js/jquery.jsAdmin template customization:: {% extends "admin/base_site.html" %} {% block extrahead %} <script type="text/javascript" src="{{ STATIC_URL }}js/jquery.js" /> {% endblock %}Custom widget:: class MyWidget(forms.TextInput): class Media: js = ('js/jquery.js',) def render(self, name, value, attrs=None): html = super(MyWidget, self).render(name, value, attrs=attrs) # ... return html
